title: Finding Maximum/Minimum Values from Vertex Form

content.problem: Find the maximum or minimum value of the quadratic function f(x) = 2(x - 3)² + 5.
steps:
Step 1: Identify whether the function has a maximum or minimum value
The function is in vertex form f(x) = a(x - h)² + k
Since a = 2 > 0, the parabola opens upward and has a minimum value

Step 2: Identify the vertex from the vertex form
Comparing with f(x) = a(x - h)² + k, we have h = 3 and k = 5
So the vertex is at (3, 5)

Step 3: State the answer
The minimum value of the function is 5, which occurs at x = 3
content.explanation: When a quadratic function is given in vertex form f(x) = a(x - h)² + k, the maximum or minimum value is simply k, and it occurs at x = h. This is one of the advantages of the vertex form - it makes the maximum or minimum value immediately apparent.
